Unlock the secrets of Ars Magica.
arsmagicalegacy.altar.lowpower: The altar power level is too low!
arsmagicalegacy.arcane_compendium.landin: A look into Minecraft with a splash of magic...
arsmagicalegacy.arcane_compendium.name: Arcane Compendium
arsmagicalegacy.chat.noInterventionDisto: You are too distorted to intervent
arsmagicalegacy.chat.noSummons: Can't summon anything else right now
arsmagicalegacy.chat.noTeleportDistortio: You are too distorted to teleport
arsmagicalegacy.inscriptiontable.name: Name
arsmagicalegacy.occulus.prevent: Mythical forces prevent you from using this device!
compendium.categories.block.name: Blocks
compendium.categories.boss.name: Bosses
compendium.categories.component.name: Components
compendium.categories.item.name: Items
compendium.categories.item.ore.name: Ores
compendium.categories.mechanic.name: Mechanics
compendium.categories.mob.name: Mobs
compendium.categories.modifier.name: Modifiers
compendium.categories.shape.name: Shapes
compendium.categories.talent.name: Talents
compendium.entries.block.altar_core.name: Altar Core
compendium.entries.block.altar_core.page: A basic yet important block, it focuses an altar's power in order to perform spell crafting.
compendium.entries.block.aum.name: Aum
compendium.entries.block.aum.page.0: A flower of health and life, used in many spell recipes.
compendium.entries.block.cerublossom.pag: One of the first magical flowers discovered, cerublossoms are used in spells, potions and vinteum purification.
compendium.entries.block.desert_nova.pag: Found in dry environments, such as deserts or badlands, the desert nova is used in vinteum purification. It also has extraordinary other magical properties for a desert plant.
compendium.entries.block.draining_well.p: The Draining Well once was used in a structure in order to transform mana into etherium, or, if powered by redstone, vice versa. However, it is currently unknown if and how this works.
compendium.entries.block.essence_refiner: Once used to purify essences from Arcane Ash and other items, the Essence Refiner currently only serves as a decorative block
compendium.entries.block.everstone.name: Everstone
It is told that everstone has similar properties to illusion blocks. However, this has not yet been rediscovered.
compendium.entries.block.flicker_lure.pa: The Flicker Lure is used to lure flickers towards itself, allowing the player to catch them. Currently, though, all rifts into the home of the flickers are closed.
compendium.entries.block.inlay.name: Inlay
compendium.entries.block.inlay.page.0: Inlays are special rails that cannot make slopes. They are used in decoration and in summoning rituals.
compendium.entries.block.inscription_tab: One of the central blocks of magic, the Inscription Table is used to create spell recipes, which can then be used in a crafting altar's lectern to start the actual spell crafting. To create a recipe, put at least one spell shape and, optionally, some modifiers into one of the gray squares ("shape groups"). Then, put some modifiers and/or components into the gray rectangle at the bottom ("spell grammar section"). When you are finished, name your spell and take out the book. If you upgrade the inscription table, you have access to more spell groups.
compendium.entries.block.keystone_door.p: Keystone Doors can be locked with a keystone combination. Due to the fact that keystone combination do not work, they practically remain unlocked. In addition, also spell sealing for Spell-Sealed Doors does not work.
compendium.entries.block.magic_wall.name: Magic Wall
compendium.entries.block.magic_wall.page: The magic wall was a nice try into illusion blocks, but it did not work. Instead, it has proven important when building crafting altars.
compendium.entries.block.mana_battery.pa: Once used to store etherium, the Mana Battery currently is decorative only.
compendium.entries.block.occulus.name: Occulus
compendium.entries.block.tarma_root.name: Tarma Root
compendium.entries.block.tarma_root.page: This important spell ingredient, especially used for air spells, is found in caves or other dark areas.
compendium.entries.block.wakebloom.name: Wakebloom
Growing in wet regions, like jungles or swamps, wakeblooms are mainly used in water-based spells.
compendium.entries.item.affinity_tome.pa: These tomes are very rare and incredibly powerful. One can use an Affinity Tome to boost themselves in the corresponding affinity, whilst removing progress in all other affinities, especially the opposite ones.
compendium.entries.item.armor.name: Armor
compendium.entries.item.armor.page.0: It is said that the two types of mage armor once were capable to repair themselves using mana, but it is unknown how this can be achieved.
compendium.entries.item.crystal_phylacte: The gravity properties of moonstone were once used to catch mobs' souls in a glass phial, but nobody knows how to do this anymore.
compendium.entries.item.crystal_wrench.p: One of the central magical tools, the Crystal Wrench is used to link various things to each other. This includes, among others, Obelisks and Crafting Altars.
Magical antimatter can be formed into Deficit Crystals, which are told to be capable of splitting spells into their crafting components.
compendium.entries.item.essence.name: Essence
compendium.entries.item.essence.page.0: Essences are physical versions of the various affinities. Obtained by bosses only, they are mainly used in spell crafting.
compendium.entries.item.flicker_focus.bu: The companion to the Progeny Flicker Focus, the fire flicker seeks to destroy them all, whilst the life flicker seeks to keep alive at least two of each mob type. Useful for automatic monster farms.
compendium.entries.item.flicker_focus.co: The companion to the Interdiction Flicker Focus, ender and air flickers working together create an invisible barrier around the habitat from which only players can escape. Useful if you want to keep monsters inside an area.
compendium.entries.item.flicker_focus.fe: The nature flicker seeks trees nearby. Once found, the lightning flicker fells them. Useful for automatic wood farms.
compendium.entries.item.flicker_focus.fi: The nature and water flickers together seek and eventually find fish in a water pool that is at least 3x3 block wide and two or more blocks deep. Useful for automatic fish farms.
compendium.entries.item.flicker_focus.fl: The companion to the Packed Earth Flicker Focus, the ice and earth flickers flatten everything around, both stone-like and dirt-like blocks. Useful if you want to build a cobblestone farm, for example.
compendium.entries.item.flicker_focus.ge: The water flicker will entirely flood its environment. Useful for example when combined with a Fishing Flicker Focus.
compendium.entries.item.flicker_focus.in: The companion to the Containment Flicker Focus, arcane and air flickers working together create an invisible barrier around the habitat that only playeers can enter. Useful if you want to keep monsters out of an area.
compendium.entries.item.flicker_focus.it: Sneak-right click a container, for example a chest, and then place the flicker focus into the habitat. It will then put items surrounding it into the linked container. Useful for (surprise!) item transport.
compendium.entries.item.flicker_focus.li: The fire and lightning flickers light up the area. Unlike the other flicker foci, this affects a radius of 16 blocks. Useful if you want a fancy torch.
compendium.entries.item.flicker_focus.lu: The three flickers together attract meteors, providing Moonstone.
compendium.entries.item.flicker_focus.na: The three flickers together help nearby plants growing.
compendium.entries.item.flicker_focus.pa: The companion to the Flat Lands Flicker Focus, the earth flicker fills the surroundings with the blocks stored in an inventory below them.
compendium.entries.item.flicker_focus.pr: The companion to the Butcher Flicker Focus, the life flicker seeks to spread life by breeding nearby animals. Useful for food farms.
compendium.entries.item.flicker_jar.name: Flicker Jar
compendium.entries.item.flicker_jar.page: Used to catch flickers, these jars are the starting point of magical automation.
compendium.entries.item.focus.name: Focus
compendium.entries.item.focus.page.0: Foci were used in machines to make them work differently. For now, the only usage is in spell crafting.
compendium.entries.item.journal.name: Journal
compendium.entries.item.journal.page.0: This old, dusty book is described in old documentations as being able to store experience within its pages. But for now, it is only another mysterious item that has no known properties.
compendium.entries.item.keystone.name: Keystone
compendium.entries.item.keystone.page.0: There are slots for runes in this keystone, but no one has managed to put runes into the stone for over thousand years.
compendium.entries.item.magitech_goggles: These glasses look really fancy. Besides, the ancient mages used it to view everything that interacted with etherium.
compendium.entries.item.magitech_staff.p: Similar to a spell book, this staff could once store spells inside. Unlike a spell book, though, it could only store one spell, instead, it had a mana buffer that charged from the wielder's mana bar and was used if they had not enough mana anymore.
compendium.entries.item.mana_cake.name: Mana Cake
compendium.entries.item.mana_cake.page.0: Regenerates both mana and hunger. But is it a lie?
compendium.entries.item.mana_martini.pag: Reduces your burnout, allowing you to continue doing magic. Shaken, not stirred.
compendium.entries.item.ore.arcane_ash.p: Arcane Compound is made from stones and dusts found in both overworld and nether. It can be blasted into Arcane Ash, a dust that has shown various useful behaviors when interacting with etherium, and therefore is one of the most important ingredients in magic.
compendium.entries.item.ore.chimerite.pa: This color-shifting mineral is used in crafting of items and spells that handle alternation or illusion.
compendium.entries.item.ore.moonstone.pa: Fallen from the sky, meteors that are occasionally found contain the rare material Moonstone, which has shown useful when magically altering stuff, such as time and gravity.
compendium.entries.item.ore.purified_vin: Vinteum is good as it is, but can be better. Adding some Arcane Ash to the blue powder, together with a cerublossom and a desert nova, creates a cleaner and thus more powerful type of vinteum.
compendium.entries.item.ore.sunstone.pag: This rare material is only found in the hottest areas, usually the nether's lava seas. If you are lucky, though, you may as well find it in a lava lake in the overworld.
compendium.entries.item.ore.topaz.page.0: A weak, but common etherium catalyst, Topaz is used in simple spells and machines.
compendium.entries.item.ore.vinteum.page: Sometimes described as blue gunpowder, Vinteum is one of the most basic components of magic, in both normal and purified state.
compendium.entries.item.rune.name: Rune
compendium.entries.item.rune.page.0: Runes are the basic building parts of spells. They come blank, as well as in the colors of the rainbow.
compendium.entries.item.spell_book.name: Spell Book
In order to organize spells, mages eventually invented the spell book. Open it with SHIFT while using, then add, order, or remove your spells. When closed, right-clicking will execute the selected spell, and using the mouse wheel while sneaking will cycle between the spells in the book's hotbar.
compendium.entries.item.wizard_chalk.pag: A magical chalk of which the usage is currently unknown.
compendium.entries.mechanic.burnout.name: Burnout
compendium.entries.mechanic.burnout.page: Using spells comes with its drawbacks. The more you use spells, the more burnout you get, causing the spells to cost more mana. Burnout will decrease over time. It is shown as a red bar in your interface.
compendium.entries.mechanic.crafting_alt: The crafting altar allows miracles of magic to work. Based on the Altar Core and the Magic Wall, the strength of the altar comes from the caps and the material. The higher the strength, the more effects a spell crafted with the altar can have.
Like normal levels, the magic level shows how strong and experienced you are. Unlike normal levels, though, magic experience cannot be spent at the enchanter or similar, instead, it decreases mana cost and unlocks more entries in this very book.
compendium.entries.mechanic.mana.name: Mana
compendium.entries.mechanic.mana.page.0: Mana represents your magical energy. It can be increased by gaining a higher magic experience level. The main usage of mana is executing spells. It is shown as a light blue bar in your interface.
compendium.entries.mechanic.silver_skill: Silver Skills are mysterious hidden spell components. They can only be obtained by creating a spell with specific components and/or modifiers (the shapes are irrelevant). To unlock them, a few tips have ever been found:$(br2)-The required parts are all in the same tree and all have to be in the same stage as the silver skill itself.$(br)-The combination doesn't require a specific order.$(br)-The required parts will make sense to the silver skill. For example, Firestorm won't require Drown.$(br)-The spell made in order to unlock the silver skill may not be commonly useful.
compendium.entries.mechanic.spell_creati: First, learn some parts at the occulus. Then, go to your Inscription Table and make a spell recipe (see the Inscription Table entry for more information on how to do this). With the recipe in your inventory, head to your crafting altar and put it onto the altar's lectern. Throw in the items that appear above the lectern - it always starts with a blank rune and ends with a spell parchment. If etherium is required, make sure you have an etherium source of the correct type connected to the altar, then switch the lever. It will draw the amount it needs automatically, no more, no less. Then, have fun with your newly created spell!

skill.arsmagicalegacy.target_non_solid.d: And I decided that I would fight the water.
